body_html:
Exactly the same situation as @visionscaper. Originally:

Socrates:~ bRad$ python -c "import tensorflow as tf"
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/Users/bRad/anaconda3/lib/python3.6/site-packages/tensorflow/python/__init__.py", line 61, in <module>
    from tensorflow.python import pywrap_tensorflow
  File "/Users/bRad/anaconda3/lib/python3.6/site-packages/tensorflow/python/pywrap_tensorflow.py", line 28, in <module>
    _pywrap_tensorflow = swig_import_helper()
  File "/Users/bRad/anaconda3/lib/python3.6/site-packages/tensorflow/python/pywrap_tensorflow.py", line 24, in swig_import_helper
    _mod = imp.load_module('_pywrap_tensorflow', fp, pathname, description)
  File "/Users/bRad/anaconda3/lib/python3.6/imp.py", line 242, in load_module
    return load_dynamic(name, filename, file)
  File "/Users/bRad/anaconda3/lib/python3.6/imp.py", line 342, in load_dynamic
    return _load(spec)
ImportError: dlopen(/Users/bRad/anaconda3/lib/python3.6/site-packages/tensorflow/python/_pywrap_tensorflow.so, 10): Library not loaded: @rpath/libcudart.8.0.dylib
  Referenced from: /Users/bRad/anaconda3/lib/python3.6/site-packages/tensorflow/python/_pywrap_tensorflow.so
  Reason: image not found

During handling of the above exception, another exception occurred:

Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "<stdin>", line 1, in <module>
  File "/Users/bRad/anaconda3/lib/python3.6/site-packages/tensorflow/__init__.py", line 24, in <module>
    from tensorflow.python import *
  File "/Users/bRad/anaconda3/lib/python3.6/site-packages/tensorflow/python/__init__.py", line 72, in <module>
    raise ImportError(msg)
ImportError: Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/Users/bRad/anaconda3/lib/python3.6/site-packages/tensorflow/python/__init__.py", line 61, in <module>
    from tensorflow.python import pywrap_tensorflow
  File "/Users/bRad/anaconda3/lib/python3.6/site-packages/tensorflow/python/pywrap_tensorflow.py", line 28, in <module>
    _pywrap_tensorflow = swig_import_helper()
  File "/Users/bRad/anaconda3/lib/python3.6/site-packages/tensorflow/python/pywrap_tensorflow.py", line 24, in swig_import_helper
    _mod = imp.load_module('_pywrap_tensorflow', fp, pathname, description)
  File "/Users/bRad/anaconda3/lib/python3.6/imp.py", line 242, in load_module
    return load_dynamic(name, filename, file)
  File "/Users/bRad/anaconda3/lib/python3.6/imp.py", line 342, in load_dynamic
    return _load(spec)
ImportError: dlopen(/Users/bRad/anaconda3/lib/python3.6/site-packages/tensorflow/python/_pywrap_tensorflow.so, 10): Library not loaded: @rpath/libcudart.8.0.dylib
  Referenced from: /Users/bRad/anaconda3/lib/python3.6/site-packages/tensorflow/python/_pywrap_tensorflow.so
  Reason: image not found


Failed to load the native TensorFlow runtime.

See https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/blob/master/tensorflow/g3doc/get_started/os_setup.md#import_error

for some common reasons and solutions.  Include the entire stack trace
above this error message when asking for help.

Based on this thread, I then created a symlink:

Socrates:~ cd /usr/local/lib
Socrates:lib ln -s ../cuda/lib/ libcudart.8.0.dylib

But with the symlink I get a "not a file" error:

Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/Users/bRad/anaconda3/lib/python3.6/site-packages/tensorflow/python/__init__.py", line 61, in <module>
    from tensorflow.python import pywrap_tensorflow
  File "/Users/bRad/anaconda3/lib/python3.6/site-packages/tensorflow/python/pywrap_tensorflow.py", line 28, in <module>
    _pywrap_tensorflow = swig_import_helper()
  File "/Users/bRad/anaconda3/lib/python3.6/site-packages/tensorflow/python/pywrap_tensorflow.py", line 24, in swig_import_helper
    _mod = imp.load_module('_pywrap_tensorflow', fp, pathname, description)
  File "/Users/bRad/anaconda3/lib/python3.6/imp.py", line 242, in load_module
    return load_dynamic(name, filename, file)
  File "/Users/bRad/anaconda3/lib/python3.6/imp.py", line 342, in load_dynamic
    return _load(spec)
ImportError: dlopen(/Users/bRad/anaconda3/lib/python3.6/site-packages/tensorflow/python/_pywrap_tensorflow.so, 10): Library not loaded: @rpath/libcudart.8.0.dylib
  Referenced from: /Users/bRad/anaconda3/lib/python3.6/site-packages/tensorflow/python/_pywrap_tensorflow.so
  Reason: no suitable image found.  Did find:
	/usr/local/lib/libcudart.8.0.dylib: not a file

During handling of the above exception, another exception occurred:

Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "<string>", line 1, in <module>
  File "/Users/bRad/anaconda3/lib/python3.6/site-packages/tensorflow/__init__.py", line 24, in <module>
    from tensorflow.python import *
  File "/Users/bRad/anaconda3/lib/python3.6/site-packages/tensorflow/python/__init__.py", line 72, in <module>
    raise ImportError(msg)
ImportError: Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/Users/bRad/anaconda3/lib/python3.6/site-packages/tensorflow/python/__init__.py", line 61, in <module>
    from tensorflow.python import pywrap_tensorflow
  File "/Users/bRad/anaconda3/lib/python3.6/site-packages/tensorflow/python/pywrap_tensorflow.py", line 28, in <module>
    _pywrap_tensorflow = swig_import_helper()
  File "/Users/bRad/anaconda3/lib/python3.6/site-packages/tensorflow/python/pywrap_tensorflow.py", line 24, in swig_import_helper
    _mod = imp.load_module('_pywrap_tensorflow', fp, pathname, description)
  File "/Users/bRad/anaconda3/lib/python3.6/imp.py", line 242, in load_module
    return load_dynamic(name, filename, file)
  File "/Users/bRad/anaconda3/lib/python3.6/imp.py", line 342, in load_dynamic
    return _load(spec)
ImportError: dlopen(/Users/bRad/anaconda3/lib/python3.6/site-packages/tensorflow/python/_pywrap_tensorflow.so, 10): Library not loaded: @rpath/libcudart.8.0.dylib
  Referenced from: /Users/bRad/anaconda3/lib/python3.6/site-packages/tensorflow/python/_pywrap_tensorflow.so
  Reason: no suitable image found.  Did find:
	/usr/local/lib/libcudart.8.0.dylib: not a file


Failed to load the native TensorFlow runtime.

See https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/blob/master/tensorflow/g3doc/get_started/os_setup.md#import_error

for some common reasons and solutions.  Include the entire stack trace
above this error message when asking for help.

My environment:

Socrates:~ bRad$ echo $DYLD_LIBRARY_PATH
/usr/local/cuda/lib:/Developer/NVIDIA/CUDA-8.0/lib:

Socrates:~ bRad$ l /usr/local/cuda/lib/libcudart.8.0.dylib
lrwxr-xr-x@ 1 root  wheel  50 Jan 11 17:33 /usr/local/cuda/lib/libcudart.8.0.dylib -> /Developer/NVIDIA/CUDA-8.0/lib/libcudart.8.0.dylib

Socrates:~ bRad$ l  /Developer/NVIDIA/CUDA-8.0/lib/libcudart.8.0.dylib
-rwxr-xr-x@ 1 root  wheel   285K Jan 11 17:32 /Developer/NVIDIA/CUDA-8.0/lib/libcudart.8.0.dylib

Simply copying the library in question doesn't work either:

Socrates:~ cd /usr/local/lib
Socrates:lib bRad$ cp ../cuda/lib/libcudart.8.0.dylib .
Socrates:lib bRad$ python -c "import tensorflow as tf"
Segmentation fault: 11

Note that the CUDA sample apps build and run fine:

Socrates:~ bRad$ cd /usr/local/cuda/bin/x86_64/darwin/release
Socrates:release bRad$ ./vectorAdd
[Vector addition of 50000 elements]
Copy input data from the host memory to the CUDA device
CUDA kernel launch with 196 blocks of 256 threads
Copy output data from the CUDA device to the host memory
Test PASSED
Done

Any ideas?
